raw_text:
Benitez issues warning to Gerrard
 
 Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez has ordered captain Steven Gerrard not to play down their Champions League ambitions and be more positive.
 
 Gerrard told the BBC Liverpool were unlikely to win the trophy this year. Benitez responded: "I spoke to Steven and said to him that in future it's better to think we can win the Champions League. Why not?" He said: "We need winners here and everyone thinking only of winning. I always want to win."
 
 Benitez added: "When we lose I only think of solutions. If you only think about winning the next game, you don't know what the draw will be. "If we can win the next game, maybe we will draw a side that isn't so strong, or a side with injuries or suspensions." Benitez is hoping to win his first trophy since arriving at Liverpool from Valencia when they play Chelsea in the Carling Cup on Sunday in Cardiff.
llama3.2:1b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez has ordered captain Steven Gerrard not to express doubts about their Champions League ambitions and instead urged him to focus on winning. Benitez responded by saying that Gerrard's negativity would hinder their chances of success, as it could lead to a weaker team drawing against stronger opponents in the draw.
llama3.2:3b: Rafael Benitez has told Steven Gerrard not to downplay Liverpool's Champions League ambitions and instead focus on winning, warning that a negative attitude could lead to mistakes, particularly about draws and opponents' weaknesses.
gemma2:2b: Rafael Benitez told Steven Gerrard to be more positive about winning the Champions League, urging him not to think about unlikely victories and instead focus on the potential for success in future matches. He believes a proactive mindset will help them navigate challenges and potentially secure advantageous draws.  Benitez is eager to win his first trophy since joining Liverpool, which he sees as a crucial step towards achieving greater success.

Benitez orders Gerrard not to play down their goals in the Champions League and emphasizes positive outlooks, while Gerrard initially expressed uncertainty about Liverpool winning this year. Benitez responds by stating he'll strive for wins in every game, especially when they lose, focusing on future goals rather than immediate successes. He aims to win his first trophy after arriving from Valencia against Chelsea in the Carling Cup.
tinyllama:1.1b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez has urged captain Steven Gerard to prioritize winning the Champions League over their Premier League title ambitions. Gerard, who is prone to expressing his frustration at being overlooked by the club's management, was reportedly told not to dwell on last season's third-placed finish and instead focus on winning silverware this year. Benitez also stated that he believes players should think more about winning when deciding how to approach matches rather than solely focusing on winning individual competitions. He expressed his hope of Liverpool winning the trophy, citing their Premier League run as an example of how a team can "win" even if they didn't secure the title itself.
tinydolphin:1.1b: In response to the question of whether Liverpool will win the Champions League this year, manager Rafael Benitez has issued a warning to captain Steven Gerrard. He stated that he wants Gerrard to think about winning the trophy and not solely focus on their own success. This approach is in line with Benitez's belief in the importance of winners thinking only about winning rather than focusing solely on individual achievements.
phi:2.7b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez has advised Steven Gerrard to be more positive about their Champions League ambitions and avoid thinking that they are unlikely to win it this year. Gerrard's negative outlook was met with a strong response from Benitez who emphasized the importance of having winners in the team and the need for solutions instead of dwelling on losses. The coach believes that even if they lose, he will still be able to find ways to improve and has high hopes of winning the Carling Cup against Chelsea on Sunday.
